StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_OpsUpdateMedHeightWeight]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@SSN varchar(10), @EXAM_TYPE varchar(4), @EXAM_DATE date.me, @HEIGHT int, @WEIGHT int as
declare @MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID int --Set's the MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID set @MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = (select PERSON_ID from PERSON where SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER = @SSN)
--Validate the SSN if @MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID is NULL BEGIN Print 'The SSN you provided is not contained in MCRISS' RETURN END
--Validate the EXAM TYPE if not exists (select 1 from MEDICAL_EXAM where MEDICAL_EXAM_TYPE = @EXAM_TYPE) BEGIN Print 'The EXAM TYPE you have entered is not valid' RETURN END
--Validate the HEIGHT if not exists(select 1 from HEIGHT_LOOKUP where HEIGHT = @HEIGHT) BEGIN Print 'The HEIGHT you have entered is not valid' RETURN END
--Validate the WEIGHT if not exists(select 1 from WEIGHT_LOOKUP where WEIGHT = @WEIGHT) BEGIN Print 'The WEIGHT you have entered is not valid' RETURN END
--Validate the Medical Exam Record if not exists (select 1 from CANDIDATE_MEDICAL_EXAM where MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID and MEDICAL_EXAM_DATE = @EXAM_DATE and MEDICAL_EXAM_TYPE = @EXAM_TYPE) BEGIN Print 'There is no medical exam record for SSN ' + @SSN + ' with the supplied values' RETURN END
UPDATE CANDIDATE_MEDICAL_EXAM set HEIGHT = @HEIGHT, WEIGHT = @WEIGHT, USER_LOGIN = 'OPS', UPDATE_DATE = getdate()
where MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID and MEDICAL_EXAM_DATE = @EXAM_DATE and MEDICAL_EXAM_TYPE = @EXAM_TYPE
Print 'The CANDIDATE MEDICAL EXAM Record has been updated for ' + @SSN
